meta_description: The American Museum of Ceramic Art / AMOCA presents exhibitions, collections, public and educational programming, and studio practice.
hours_text:
## Museum Visitor Information

The museum is currently open Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 11 AM–4 PM. Tickets can be purchased at the door.

* * *

### Ticket Prices

  * $14 – Adult
  * $9 – Senior (age 62+)
  * $9 – Military (w/proof of service)
  * $7 – Pomona resident, Student, Educator (w/current ID)
  * $0 – Youth (ages 0-12)
  * $0 – [AMOCA Member ](https://www.amoca.org/membership/)
  * $9 – Guest of AMOCA Member (accompanied by AMOCA Member)

AMOCA is open 11AM–4PM on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. AMOCA Members can also visit on Wednesdays and Thursdays, with advance reservation.

Tickets can be purchased at the door. Reservations or arrangements for larger group visits can be made by email ([info@amoca.org](mailto:info@amoca.org)) or by calling (909) 865-3146 during regular business hours.

No pets allowed in the museum. Service animals are welcome.

> In these times of uncertainty and fear, the American Museum of Ceramic Art (AMOCA) remains a welcoming space for all people, regardless of their immigration status, country of origin, or background. Art, culture, and creativity transcend borders and unite us in our shared humanity. AMOCA is proud to be part of our diverse community, and we will continue to create an inclusive environment for all, where every individual feels valued, respected, and safe.   
>   
> En estos tiempos de incertidumbre y temor, el Museo Americano de Arte Cerámico (AMOCA) sigue siendo un espacio acogedor para todas las personas, in...

The museum is open Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays, 11 AM–4 PM. Plan your visit by [clicking here](https://www.amoca.org/visit/reserve-tickets/).

For information about Ceramics Studio hours and availability, please click here for the [**Ceramics Studio**](https://www.amoca.org/studio1/).
